summary: This bill (S. 643) amends the Grand Ronde Reservation Act to address the hunting, fishing, trapping, and animal gathering rights of the Confederated Tribes of the Grand Ronde Community. It clarifies the status of existing agreements related to these rights, allows for future amendments by mutual consent between the Tribe and the State of Oregon, and outlines limitations on the scope and impact of any new agreements, emphasizing that they derive from the authority of the State. It also specifies judicial review procedures regarding the Consent Decree.
